input.placeholder: What can we help you find?

div.h3:
Check out the latest:
Saints Scribe Distance Learning Newsletter

div.p: Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,

Good evening. As Iâ€™m sure you have heard, Governor Walz has ordered public school buildings to remain closed for the remainder of the school year. Under the order, â€œDistance Learningâ€ plans that have been in place since Monday, March 30th will continue through Thursday, May 28th.

While this is not the news any of us were hoping for, I am confident that our staff will continue to deliver high-quality instruction during this period. I also know that we live in a community that is very supportive of our students and our schools. Together, we will get through this challenge!
I also want to let you know of a number of items:

ol.li: Per the Governorâ€™s order, we will not be having online classes on May 1st and May 4th. These two days will be staff planning days focused on monitoring, adjusting, and finalizing our instructional delivery model for May 5th through May 28th.

â€œSaints Careâ€ for our emergency and critical workers and the meal distribution program will continue through May 28th, including May 1st and May 4th. We are awaiting direction as to whether or not these services will continue after May 28th.
Plans will be developed and shared by next Wednesday for students and families to pick up personal belongings, medications, etc. from the schools.
Information regarding cap and gown pick-up for seniors will be coming on Monday, April 27th.
Specific plans for key events such as prom, senior awards night, and graduation will be shared with students and families no later than May 5th.

div.p: Every effort will be made during the remainder of the school year to personally connect with students and to provide opportunities for students to connect with one another.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,

Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Questions related to COVID-19 and Saint Peter Schools can be sent to COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org
December 5, 2019
Dear Parents and Guardians,
Please be aware that we have had reports of confirmed Influenza A cases these past few days in our school community.

Influenza symptoms include a sudden onset of high fever, headache, extreme tiredness, dry cough, sore throat, and body aches. Influenza symptoms are similar to a common cold only more severe. Be sure to contact your physician if your child has a prolonged fever or respiratory illness. Influenza can cause pneumonia which requires medical care and follow-up.
Important steps in preventing influenza are:

ul.li: have the influenza vaccine
careful and frequent hand washing
cover your cough
keep your children home if they are ill
avoid touching your face

div.p: It is not too late to have a flu vaccine! If a child is running a temperature in the morning they need to stay home from school. Students need to be fever free without the use of a fever reducing medication for a full 24 hours before returning to school. Influenza is most contagious during the time a child is running a fever. If a child receives Tylenol (acetaminophen) or Advil (ibuprofen) in the morning, it does not reduce the contagiousness of the illness.
Students who are ill should stay home for their own health as well as for the health of others.
Thank you for your efforts to minimize the spread of influenza.
If you have any questions, please call:
Kari Peterson, R.N. at 507 934 2754, ext. 3054- South Elementary
Mary Powers, R.N. at 934-3260, ext. 4008- North Elementary
Rachel Fitch, R.N. at 934-4210, ext. 5093- Middle School and High School
Click here for: Influenza Symptom Screening Tool for Parents and Caregivers
Click here for: Influenza (Flu) Information for Parents
February 27, 2020
Dear Parents & Guardians,

As public health officials expected to happen, the coronavirus (COVID-19) has been found in the United States. It is important to know that at this time there are no known cases in the South-Central region or in the rest of Minnesota. It's also worth noting that generally the risk of people in Minnesota schools becoming sick with coronavirus disease is very low. We continue to monitor the latest developments because the safety of the people in our schools is our top priority. We are in close contact with the Minnesota Department of Public Health and Nicollet County Public Health and we are receiving updates from the federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to ensure our school district has the latest information.
Basic health preventions continue to be usefulâ€”especially during cold and flu season:

ul.li: Consider getting a seasonal flu shot. It's not too late!
Children stay home from school until fever free for 24 hours without fever reducing medication.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth. Germs spread this way.
Cover coughs and sneezes. Use a tissue to cover coughs and sneezes, then dispose of the tissue. When a tissue is not available, cough or sneeze into your elbow.
Clean and disinfect surfaces or objects. Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces at home, work or school, especially when someone is ill.

div.p: Wash hands for 20 seconds. Washing hands often under clean, running water can help prevent the spread of germs. If you cannot wash your hands, use alcohol-based hand sanitizer
Anyone with specific questions or concerns is asked to contact Saint Peter Public Schoolsâ€™ District School Nurse, Rachel Fitch at 507-934-4210, ext. 5093.

Sincerely
Jeffrey J. Olson, PhD
Superintendent of Schools
March 12, 2020
Dear Parents & Guardians,

As public health officials expected, the Coronavirus (COVID-19) has been found in the United States and now presumptive cases in Minnesota. At this time there are no known cases in the South-Central region. We continue to monitor the latest developments because the safety of the children and adults in our schools is our top priority. We are in close contact with the Minnesota Department of Public Health and Nicollet County Public Health and we are receiving updates from the federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to ensure our school district has the latest information. We will keep you updated with new information as it becomes available.
Please remember to encourage your family to follow good health hygiene by following the recommendations listed below:

ol.li: Wash hands for 20 seconds. Washing hands often under clean, running water can help prevent the spread of germs. If you cannot wash your hands, use alcohol-based hand sanitizer
Avoid touching your eyes, nose or mouth. Germs spread this way.
Donâ€™t share personal items like drinks, food, unwashed utensils, or anything that goes into the mouth (cups, straws, water bottles).
Cover coughs and sneezes.
Clean and disinfect surfaces or objects and frequently touched surfaces at home, work or school. Especially when someone is ill.

Keep your children home if they have influenza-like illness. Please see the enclosed Influenza-like Illness Symptom Screener. Any children who are determined to be sick while at school will be sent home.
Contact your health care provider if a family member has difficulty breathing or has a high fever or vomiting or diarrhea that lasts more than 2-3 days.

Students/staff with any of the influenza-like symptoms should stay homeâ€”Please Note: Children under the age of five should stay home for 7 days after symptoms begin or at least 24 hours after the child is well, whichever is longer.

All Pre-K through grade twelve students who have missed school with influenza-like illness will be asked to complete and return the Parental Verification of Influenza-like Illness form included in this mailing.

div.p: Anyone with specific questions or concerns is asked to contact Saint Peter Public Schoolsâ€™ District School Nurse, Rachel Fitch at 507-934-4210, ext. 5093

strong.em: Under the recommendation of District 508 school nurses, DO NOT give aspirin or salicylate-containing medicines to anyone under 19 years of age because it can cause Reyeâ€™s Syndrome, a serious neurological condition.

div.p:
Sincerely,
Jeffrey J. Olson, PhD
Superintendent of Schools
March 13, 2020
Dear Saint Peter Schools Parents and School Community,

Saint Peter Public Schools administration continues to closely monitor the situation regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19) and other influenza-like illnesses and wanted to provide the following updates, based upon the most recent information we have received from the Minnesota Department of Health and Center for Disease Control and Prevention. Those updates include:

ol.li: The Minnesota Department of Health (MDH) and Center for Disease Control (CDC) are not recommending closing schools at this time.
The MDH and CDC have provided a â€œSchool Closure Treeâ€ to follow when making a decision about closing school.
If there is a need to consider closing our schools due to a confirmed COVID 19 case in our school community, MDH and Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) will provide direct guidance to follow.
We are following MDH guidelines in terms of â€œPrinciples of Mitigationâ€ which include:

ul.li: Social Distancing
Reducing large group gatherings
Staggering recess times
Developing and implementing individual plans for students and staff with underlying health conditions
Eliminating large group events at all school sites

ol.li: We have a â€œContinuity of Learning Planâ€ ready to go should a recommendation be made by the CDC, MDH, and MDE to close our schools.
We realize that this is a fluid situation and we remain in regular contact with MDH officials and Nicollet County Public Health.
As new information is learned, we will provide communications and updates to our students, staff, and families.

div.p:
Sincerely,
Jeffrey J. Olson, PhD
Superintendent of Schools
Dear Saint Peter Schools Community and Families,

Minnesota Governor Tim Walz announced statewide school closures starting this week and provided local districts with guidance on how to proceed with the closures. The Saint Peter Schools administrive team is meeting to finalize plans for Saint Peter Schools on March 16th and 17th as well as during the extended March 18th - 27th closure. More specific information on the closures and plans will be shared later today.

Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter Schools Community and Families,

Good afternoon Saint Peter Public Schools and MVED students, staff, and families. This is Jeff Olson, Superintendent of Schools, with an important school closure announcement. All schools in the district will be closed beginning, Monday, March 16 through Friday, March 27. Monday, March 16 and Tuesday, March 17, will be â€œFlexible Learning Days.â€ Wednesday, March 18 through Friday, March 27 schools will be closed to allow staff time to develop comprehensive and long-term distance learning plans.

Please note that all buildings in the district will be closed during this time period and all practices and events have been canceled. At the discretion of the parents and guardians, families and students are allowed to come to a school site to retrieve personal belongings and school supplies on Monday, March 16 between 8 a.m. and 4 p.m.
Again, students and staff will be participating in flexible learning days on March 16 and March 17. Principals can be reached by phone or email and I encourage you to contact them with questions.
Thank you for your understanding as we move through uncertain times.
Dear Parents,

School Age Care (SAC) will be available to students in grades K-6 who have parents that work in healthcare, emergency medical services, long-term and post-acute care; law enforcement personnel; personnel providing correctional services; public health employees; firefighters or other first responders during the time that Governor Walz has ordered a statewide closure of schools.

p.strong: To help us identify if your child is in need of care, please complete this SAC Family Survey. In order for us to plan for staffing needs, we need your response by 1 p.m. on Tuesday, March 17.

div.p: Thank you,

Tami Skinner
Director of Community & Family Education

Jane Timmerman
Interim School Age Care Coordinator
Dear Saint Peter Schools Community and Families,

Good afternoon, this is a reminder that Tuesday, March 17th, will be a â€œFlex Learningâ€ day and the last day of 3rd Quarter. Wednesday, March 18th, is a teacher work and grading day, with no instruction for students. March 19th through March 27th will have no instruction for students as administrators and faculty work to prepare for delivery of instruction through distance learning.
There are a few additional informational items we would like to share updates on at this time:

ol.li: School buildings will again be open on Tuesday, March 17th, from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm for students to pick up belongings and medications. We do not have future plans to keep the buildings open to the public beyond Tuesday.

A dedicated email address has been set-up for families who have questions about COVID-19 and Saint Peter Schools. Please send questions to COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org between 8 a.m. to 3 p.m., Monday through Friday. COVID-19 questions not related to Saint Peter Schools can be answered through the Minnesota state hotline at 651-201-3920 or 1-800-657-3903.

We are finalizing plans for providing meals to all students under the age of 18 utilizing school transportation routes and designated pick up locations beginning on Wednesday. Detailed information will be sent out tomorrow.

div.p: We continue to get updated guidance on educational procedures and precautionary measures every day. Our plans are updated each day and we will strive to provide regular, timely updates to families as the situation allows.

Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter Community and Families,

Good evening. This is a reminder that Wednesday, March 18th is a teacher work and grading day with no instruction for students. March 19th through March 27th will have no instruction for students as administrators and faculty work to prepare for delivery of instruction through distance learning.

Beginning Wednesday, March 18th, meal distribution for all children age 18 and under will be made available at various locations. These meals are at no cost and may be picked up by a parent, guardian or student at any of the distribution locations. Meal distribution times and locations are as follows:

South Elementary-1405 South 7th Street
7:30AM-9:00AM and 11:00AM-12:45PM

North Elementary-815 North 9th Street
7:30AM-9:00AM and 11:00AM-12:45PM

Saint Peter Middle School-100 Lincoln Drive
7:30AM-9:00AM and 11:00AM-12:45PM
We will also plan to have pick-up available at various neighborhood locations in Saint Peter and Kasota. Please check the District website for additional information.
We are in uncharted territory and we greatly appreciate your support and patience. We saw this message posted on a school website and wanted to share it.

p.strong: â€œBreaking News for Families and Studentsâ€

ul.li: Getting Outdoors-not cancelled
Music-not cancelled
Family-not cancelled
Reading-not cancelled
Singing-not cancelled
Laughing-not cancelled
Hope-not cancelled

div.p: Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€

Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good afternoon, this is a reminder that March 19th through March 27th will have no instruction for students as we work to prepare for delivery of instruction through distance learning.

Please know that our administration and all staff will be taking an â€œall hands on deckâ€ approach to creating this plan. While we all hope to return to the classroom before the end of the school year, we are preparing as if distance learning will be the new norm.

One of the biggest challenges for a distance learning program is ensuring that ALL our students have access to the technology and resources necessary for them to receive a quality education. This will be a key focus as we work over the next seven days. You can expect to receive information next week about requesting technology devices for our PreK-8 students and families in need of a device.

We encourage you to participate in our breakfast and lunch programs. Today, we provided over 825 meals to district students! Meals can be picked up at South Elementary, North Elementary, or the Middle School. Meals will also be available at normal morning bus stops at normal times in the towns of Saint Peter and Kasota only.
Because these are circumstances we have never experienced before, our plans could quickly change and evolve.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€

Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,

Good afternoon. This is a reminder that March 20th through March 27th will have no instruction for students as we continue to develop plans for delivery of instruction through distance learning beginning Monday, March 30th.

We continue to encourage you to participate in our breakfast and lunch programs. Yesterday we distributed 800 meals and today the number climbed to 1,100. As a reminder, there is no charge for the meals for anyone age 18 and under.

One of our goals for today and tomorrow is to make a personal contact with every family in the school district. We know that these are stressful times and we want everyone to know that we stand ready to assist families and students in any way that we can.
Because these are circumstances we have never experienced before, our plans could quickly change and evolve.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€

Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good afternoon. Please be reminded that our schools will be closed March 23-27 as we continue to plan and prepare for distance learning.
We know that waiting and wondering about what lies ahead is hard. One of our goals is to keep you informed of our plans as we know them today.
Here are a few updates for next week:

ul.li: We will be implementing a plan for families to request a device for all students in PreK - grade 8.
We will be implementing a plan to test our technology delivery to all students.
We will be finalizing plans to have distance learning lessons delivered to students with IEPs, those learning English as a new language and those who need mental health support.
We will be communicating with students and families on how we will be taking attendance and showing student progress.
We will be sharing our distance learning plans with families and posting those plans on our website.

div.p: I am very proud to be a part of our staff. They have all been working incredibly hard with an â€œall hands on deckâ€ approach to serving meals, caring for the children of emergency and critical workers and preparing to deliver high quality distance learning to all students. The ongoing and unwavering commitment of our staff and school board is to place the education and well being of our students â€œfront and center.â€
Thank you for your continuous support during these difficult times. We are a strong, supportive and resilient community. We will get through this together.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€

Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good afternoon. Please be reminded that our schools will be closed March 24-27 as we continue to plan and prepare for distance learning.
Three important announcements are as follows:

ul.li: The district will be distributing technology to elementary and middle school students later this week. Visit the school website for details.

The district has added an afternoon bus route to drop off meals in the cities of Saint Peter and Kasota. Buses will drop off meals at the same locations as during the morning routes. Specific details will be provided in a separate email.
The Minnesota Department of Education will be requesting a waiver from the requirement to give MCA/MTAS tests in the likelihood that we move forward with distance learning plans on March 30th.

div.p: Thank you for your patience and understanding at this time. It has been an inspiration to see the way our school staff and entire community have come together over the past ten days.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,

Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good afternoon. Please be reminded that our schools will be closed March 25-27 as we prepare for distance learning.
Please note the following:

ul.li: It is important that you complete the Distance Learning Device Request Form. If you are unable to complete the form online, please email your request to COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org or phone in your request at 507-934-4210.
The Districtâ€™s Distance Learning Plan will be posted online and emailed to you on Friday, March 27th. If you have any questions about the plan, send them to COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org.
We will be developing and implementing plans to have weekly personal contact with each student in the district. This will be more challenging with younger learners, so bear with us.
We continue to offer free breakfasts and lunches to all children under the age 18 through both city bus routes and can be picked up at South, North, and the Middle School.

div.p: I think it is important to have your student on a regular schedule for the next few days so that we are ready to go with teaching and learning on March 30th.

I also want you to know that we are doing our very best in planning for distance learning. Our plans will not be without fault, but we are following the rule of not letting â€œperfect get in the way of goodâ€.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,

Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools

Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. Please be reminded that our schools will be closed March 26-27 as we finalize our plans for distance learning.
Key information:

ul.li: The Governor has officially announced that distance learning will be in place from March 30th through April 30th. Students will begin learning from home starting Monday. School buildings will be closed to the general public during this period.
Meals distribution and Saints Care for emergency medical staff and first responders will continue.
Building Principals will be sending you distance learning plans for their respective schools on Friday, March 27th.
The comprehensive â€œDistrict-Wide Distance Learning Planâ€ will be posted on our website (https://www.stpeterschools.org/) on Friday, March 27th.
Over the next two days, we will be practicing how we connect with students and families. Please give us feedback if there are any issues or concerns.

If your 9th-12th grade student has a school device that is in need of repair, they can request a repair using our Online Repair Request form and a technician from the technology department will arrange for repairs.
Between Wednesday, March 18th and Wednesday March 25th we have served 8,797 meals to our students throughout the district.

div.p:
As we begin distance learning next week, our plan is to make personal connections with students, provide support to all in understanding how distance learning will work and establish routines in terms of what â€œschoolâ€ will look and feel like.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,
Jeff Olson,
PhDSuperintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Questions related to COVID-19 and Saint Peter Schools can be sent to COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org

Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. Please be reminded that our schools will be closed March 27 as we put the final touches on our plan to begin distance learning on Monday, March 30th.
As you are probably aware, Governor Walz has directed that all public schools implement distance learning between March 30th and May 4th. During the distance learning period, public school buildings and facilities must be closed to the general public.
Announcements/Reminders:
* - Building Principals will be sending you distance learning plans for their respective schools on Friday, March 27th.
* - The comprehensive â€œDistrict-Wide Distance Learning Planâ€ will be posted on our website on Friday, March 27th.
* - We will be continuing to practice how we connect with students tomorrow. Please give us feedback if you have any questions or concerns.

We really need to all work together in order to make distance learning work for our students. We ask you to support us by ensuring your children participate in â€œDistance Learningâ€ every day. We are confident that we can work out any problems or concerns if we openly engage and communicate with one another.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. Please be reminded that we are scheduled to start distance learning with all of our students on Monday, March 30, 2020.

Today, each of you should have received information from your studentâ€™s principal regarding distance learning plans for next week and beyond. If you did not receive this information, please call your studentâ€™s school:

Early Childhood Education: 934-4211 ext 1010
South Elementary: 934-2754 ext 3031
North Elementary: 934-3260 ext 4005
Saint Peter Middle School: 934-4210 ext 5019
Saint Peter High School: 934-4212 ext 6099
Minnesota Valley Education District: 934-5420 ext 1221

You can also email your request to COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org. As we get to the weekend and the Governorâ€™s Stay-at-Home Order goes into effect, we encourage you to take some time to relax, exercise, get outside, read for pleasure and begin preparing for the start of distance learning on Monday.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,

Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools

Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. Please be reminded that we are scheduled to start distance learning with all of our students beginning tomorrow, Monday, March 30, 2020.
Last Friday, you received information from Building Principals giving you guidance on how â€œDistance Learningâ€ is planned for our students.
We want all parents, guardians, and students to know that we are going to begin the Distance Learning process on a gradual basis. The first few days with â€œDistance Learningâ€ will be focused on reconnecting with our students and troubleshooting our delivery model. We will begin to introduce lessons and course content with an â€œeyeâ€ on ensuring that our systems are working.
It is important that we work together to reduce the anxiety we will all have in re-starting our school year in a different way. Our goal is to improve the way we connect and interact with our students every single day.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools

Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. Today was our first day of Distance Learning in the Saint Peter and MVED schools. I know that our staff were excited to connect with kids and re-establish a teaching and learning environment, albeit in a different way.
If you or your student are experiencing any difficulties with our District Learning Plan, we want to hear from you. Please email our COVID-19 Information line or call your studentâ€™s school. We really want to make sure that we are providing all of our students with a quality education.
We encourage you to establish a regular â€œschool scheduleâ€ for your student and to have a designated place for â€œattending schoolâ€ remotely.
We also want to remind K-8 parents that online or telephone parent-teacher conferences will be held on Thursday, April 2nd and Tuesday, April 7th. Please reserve your time slot if you have not done so yet.
At the present time, we will be moving to a weekly check-in with our community and families. You can expect a communication each Wednesday evening at 6:30PM for the month of April.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools

Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. Today was our third day of Distance Learning in the Saint Peter and MVED schools. Please know that our staff are working hard at making personal connections with students and introducing school work for their grade or course level.
As you identify problems, issues or concerns with our delivery model, we want to hear from you. If you email our COVID-19 Information line, please include your studentâ€™s name along with the name of the teacher for the grade level or class of your student. You can also call your studentâ€™s school to receive assistance.
Also, please note the following:

ul.li: â€œSaints Careâ€ is closed during Spring Break, April 9-14.

Breakfast and lunch will not be available during Spring Break, April 9-15. However, meal packs will be distributed to District 508 students ages 18 & under on Wednesday, April 8. Click HERE for meal packs distribution info and menu. For Spanish version click HERE.
Distance Learning will not occur during Spring Break, April 9-14.

div.p:
Saints Care and Distance Learning will resume on Wednesday, April 15, while the meal distribution will resume on Thursday, April 16. (PLEASE NOTE: The date for meal distribution resuming was originally reported as April 15th, but staff will need that day to prepare meals for April 16th. There is enough food included in the meal packs to go through April 15th.)
As we continue this journey together, you have our commitment to do our very best. We know that there will be anxiety and stress in this new system. Good open communication and a dose of patience will go a long way in making Distance Learning work effectively.
Our next communication is set for Wednesday, April 8th.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools

Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. This evening we are communicating to you with three important reminders:

ol.li: Saints Care will be closed during Spring Break, April 9-14.

Regular meal distribution will not occur during Spring Break. However, Saint Peter Schools will be offering â€œFree Spring Break Meal Packsâ€ for children ages 1-18. Each child will receive a large bag of food to make breakfast and lunch for eight days. Meal Packs will be distributed at existing food distribution bus stops and school sites. Specific instructions for storing and preparing the meals will be included with the Meal Packs. Meal distribution will resume on Thursday, April 16, 2020.

We will continue with Distance Learning for all Pre-K to Grade 12 students on Wednesday, April 8th. This day was originally scheduled as a Pre-K to Grade 8 Parent/Teacher Conference Day, but was changed to a regular school day to maximize learning opportunities during the 4th quarter.

div.p:
We will be sending you our regular communication tomorrow evening.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools

Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. Today marks the eighth day of Distance Learning in Saint Peter and MVED Schools. From our perspective, our Distance Learning Plans are working fairly well. At the same time, we know there have been some glitches, problems, and frustrations.
To that end, our building level administrators have sent you a short survey to gain some information on our progress in delivering high-quality education through our Distance Learning model. We appreciate your taking the time to complete and submit the survey at your earliest convenience.
I am very proud of the efforts of all of our staff in making personal connections with our students, delivering academic content, providing meals and caring for children of our emergency, health care, and essential workers.
As we are about to start our Spring Break; please take some time to relax, recharge your â€œbatteriesâ€, and prepare for the last 31 days of the 4th quarter.
We need to continue to work together to best meet the needs of our students and families. I canâ€™t help but think of the old adage, â€œLight is the task where many share the toil.â€
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,
Good evening. Welcome back to school today! I know that our teachers and staff were excited to get started with our Distance Learning Plans following our Spring Break.

We have 30 days of school left beginning tomorrow and going through Thursday, May 28th. Our commitment to you is to deliver high-quality education whether we re-start school on May 5th or have Distance Learning extended through the remainder of the school year.
I also want to let you know of a couple of items:

ul.li: We will continue to provide free meals for children ages 1-18 beginning tomorrow through the remainder of the distance learning period. Meals will be distributed at existing food distribution bus stops and school sites.

We continue to develop â€œcontingency plansâ€ for major school events should schools be closed for the rest of the school year. Information regarding graduation was communicated to parents/guardians of seniors and members of the Class of 2020 yesterday evening via email.
Previously scheduled â€œEarly Releaseâ€ days set for April 24 and May 15 have been canceled. These days will now be regular school days.

div.p: Our next communication is set for April 22, 2020.
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€

Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
Dear Saint Peter and MVED Community and Families,

Good evening. We know that you are all waiting to learn whether or not Distance Learning will be extended through the end of the school year. We expect that a decision will be made very soon. As soon as we learn about the decision, we will be in contact to share our plans for the remainder of the school year. Whatever the decision, please know that you have our unwavering commitment to provide high quality education for all students over the remaining 25 days of school.
I also want to let you know of a couple of items:

ul.li: We will be sending out building specific student surveys to our grades 4-12 students on Friday. We really want to hear from our students about how things are going and about â€œwhatâ€™s on their mindsâ€ during this Distance Learning period.

We are in the early stages of planning for summer school. At the present time, we are looking at all summer school programming beginning on Monday, July 20th and continuing through Friday, August 14th. The reason for our planning for these dates is our hope that our summer program will be offered in our buildings and not online.

div.p:
It is my hope that we all stay positive as we deal with this situation and look for better days ahead. I am reminded of Winston Churchillâ€™s address to the British House of Commons in the darkest hour of WWII where he stated â€œWe are still masters of our fate, we are still captains of our souls.â€
Please know that we will continue to do all we can to support our â€œSaint Peter Saints.â€
Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools
